borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>The part-two storey rear extension will appear as a dominant feature of the host dwelling when viewed from neighbouring gardens. This would be at odds with the existing character of the area which is contrary to the above development plan policies. The proposed development is therefore contrary to:&nbsp;</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies D4 and D8 of the London Plan (March 2021);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies BP2, and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);&nbsp;</p><p>- The residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and SPP6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020)</p>

<p>The scale, siting and design of the double storey side extension will erode the existing gap between the application site and No.10 Lichfield Road.&nbsp; This is considered harmful to the character of the street scene and the wider Becontree Estate. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:&nbsp;</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</p><p>- Policies D4 and D8 of the London Plan (March 2021);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies BP2, and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);&nbsp;</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and SPP6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020)</p>

<p>Officers consider the proposed part double storey rear and side extensions will represent uncharacteristic additions to the property, thereby detrimental to the character and appearance of the street scene, dwellinghouse, wider terrace and the distinctive Becontree Estate. The scale and massing of the proposed extensions are not subservient or proportionate in their design when viewed against the scale and context of the existing dwelling.&nbsp; The proposed development is therefore contrary to:&nbsp;</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policy D4 and D8 of the London Plan (March 2021);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies BP2, and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);&nbsp;</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and SPP6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020)</p>
description: Construction of part two storey part single storey side and rear extensions involving new windows to the front, rear and side elevations
